title.native: アークナイツ アニメPVs

description:
Assorted commercials for the mobile game Arknights. These short animations aired on TV and were posted to Arknights YouTube channel, while additionally shared via Twitter, advertising the game and associated events after its Japan launch.

The list of the commercials are as follows (note that CMs without animation are not present and, for the ones with long and short versions, the longer version is taken into consideration)

1) Official Animation Trailer (アニメPV) [7 January 2020]
2) Grani and the Knights’ Treasure (騎兵と狩人) [30 January 2020]
3) EP05 Necessary Solutions (第五章「快刀乱麻」) [5 March 2020]
4) Operational Intelligence (戦地の逸話) [25 March 2020]
5) Heart of Surging Flame (青く燃ゆる心) [21 April 2020]
6) Code of Brawl (喧騒の掟) [25 May 2020]
7) Partial Necrosis (第六章「局部壊死」) [22 June 2020]
8) Ancient Forge (洪炉示歳（エンシェントフォージ）) [22 July 2020]
9) Stories of Afternoon (午後の逸話) [25 August 2020]
10) Children of Ursus (ウルサスの子供たち) [25 September 2020]
11) Twilight of Wolumonde (ウォルモンドの薄暮) [22 October 2020]
12) Darknights Memoir (闇夜に生きる) [8 December 2020]
13) The Birth of Tragedy (第七章「苦難揺籃」) [24 December 2020]
14) Heart of Surging Flame - Rerun (復刻「青く燃ゆる心」) [18 January 2021]
15) The Great Chief Returns (帰還！密林の長) [19 February 2021]
16) Rewinding Breeze (在りし日の風を求めて) [22 March 2021]
17) Maria Nearl (マリア・ニアール) [5 April 2021]
18) Roaring Flare (第八章「怒号光明」) [21 April 2021]
19) Mansfield Break (孤島激震) [18 June 2021]
20) Beyond Here (彼方を望む) [2 July 2021]
21) Who Is Real (画中人) [22 July 2021]
22) Operation Originium Dust (オペレーション オリジニウムダスト) [13 August 2021]
23) A Walk in The Dust (遺塵の道を) [28 September 2021]
24) Under Tides (潮汐の下) [15 October 2021]
25) Preluding Lights (灯火序曲) [6 December 2021]
26) Dossoles Holiday (ドッソレスホリデー) [9 January 2022]
27) Stormwatch (第九章「暴風眺望」) [15 March 2022]
28) Pinus Sylvestris (赤松林) [11 April 2022]
29) Near Light (ニアーライト) [21 April 2022]
30) Break the Ice (風雪一過) [27 June 2022]
31) Invitation to Wine (将進酒) [23 July 2022]
32) A Light Spark in Darkness (闇散らす火花) [16 August 2022]
33) Guide Ahead (吾れ先導者たらん) [13 September 2022]
34) Shatterpoint (第十章「光冠残蝕」) [17 October 2022]
35) Stultifera Navis (狂人号) [21 October 2022]
36) Lingering Echoes (塵影に交わる残響) [23 December 2022]
37) Ideal City: Endless Carnival (理想都市-エンドレスカーニバル-) [7 January 2023]
38) Dorothy's Vision (翠玉の夢) [10 March 2023]
39) An Obscure Wanderer (夕景に影ありて) [27 March 2023]
40) Return to Mist (第十一章「淬火煙塵」) [24 April 2023]
41) IL Siracusano (シラクザーノ) [15 May 2023]
42) What The Firelight Casts (この炎が照らす先) [10 June 2023]
43) Where Vernal Winds Will Never Blow (登臨意) [22 July 2023]
44) A Death in Chunfen (春分) [18 August 2023]
45) All Quiet under the Thunder (第十二章「驚靂蕭然」) [20 October 2023]
46) Lone Trail (孤星) [4 November 2023]
47) Hortus de Escapismo (空想の花庭) [18 December 2023]
48) KFCコラボ [13 January 2024]
49) So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home (火山と雲と夢色の旅路) [13 January 2024]
50) The Black Forest Wills A Dream (樹影にて眠る) [23 February 2024]
51) Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures (ダーティマネー) [15 March 2024]
52) The Whirlpool that is Passion (第十三章「悪兆渦流」) [12 April 2024]
53) Zwillingstürme im Herbst (ツヴィリングトゥルムの黄金) [23 April 2024]
54) The Rides to Lake Silberneherze (銀心湖鉄道) [18 June 2024]
55) To the Grinning Valley (ニヤニヤ谷へ) [5 July 2024]
56) Here A People Sows (懐黍離) [27 July 2024]
57) Operation Lucent Arrowhead (オペレーション ルーセントアローヘッド) [2 September 2024]
58) Babel (バベル) [8 October 2024]
59) Absolved Will Be the Seekers (第十四章「慈悲光塔」) [26 October 2024]
60) Path of Life (生存航路) [29 November 2024]
61) Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun (太陽すらも追い越して) [12 January 2025]
62) A Kazdelian Rescue (溶炉『還魂』 譚) [4 February 2025]
63) Ending a Grand Overture (落日の向こうへ) [4 April 2025]
64) I Portatori dei Velluti (幕開く者たち) [19 April 2025]
65) Exodus from the Pale Sea (白き海の彼方へ) [30 May 2025]

tags.name: Advertisement
tags.description: Produced in order to promote the products of a certain company.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Pandemic
tags.description: Prominently features a disease prevalent over a whole country or the world.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

title.native: アークナイツ 黎明前奏

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cnago) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/椎名豪)

Masaru Shiina, known professionally as Go Shiina, is a freelance composer and arranger.

He joined Namco in 1997, and was best known during his time with the company for writing music for a number of games in the Tales, Mr. Driller, and God Eater franchises, He gained widespread recognition with his score for Tales of Legendia in 2005. Since then, he has also contributed music for several titles in the Tekken, Ace Combat, and The Idolmaster franchises.

In anime he is most noted for the score of [Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/) together with [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/).
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/118512/) or [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/218342/) by the same name._

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kazuki.niwa.18)

Currently works for [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable). Previously worked for [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/Yostar-Pictures) and CG company [Cre-p](http://www.cre-p.co.jp/).
The CEO of Yokohama Animation Lab

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/nao.hirasawa)

Hirasawa Nao is a Japanese publicity and production manager, producer, animation planner and animation producer. He is the founder and CEO of company [ARCH](https://archinc.jp/ja/).

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/people/Tetsushi-Suzuki/100004489592504/)

President and current representative director of company [ARCH](https://archinc.jp/ja/). Formerly an employee at [Broccoli](https://anilist.co/studio/116/Broccoli) and [Production I.G.](https://anilist.co/studio/10/Production-IG)

[Profile (ARCH)](https://archinc.jp/ja/member) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kinoria/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kinoria) | [Linkedin](https://jp.linkedin.com/in/kinoria)

Currently a founder and director of company [ARCH](https://archinc.jp/ja/) and founder and representative director at [Mustache Inc](http://mustache-inc.co.jp/company/). Former founder and employee at Applica Inc.
